metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11641 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has a Memory Leak in the PersistCache function in magick/pixel_cache.c during writing of Magick Persistent Cache (MPC) files. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11641` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-4
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-4
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-4
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-4
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-4').
